01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Rejoicing at the coming together of two armies, reports began to surface that Aegon Targaryen, Orys Baratheon and the Two Kings had gathered south of the Blackwater along one of the most crucial routes: The goldroad. As they advanced forward, people reported a wide, open and ideal area for a firm siege which was further enhanced by a cloudless sky over head with a cool windy breeze. They knew it would be difficult to withstand such an attack; but they marched on none the less commaned by their King. They crossed The gods Eye and moved onward to Stoney Sept before finally joineding forces with Princess Meria and Queen Rhaenys in Crackclaw Point where all three dragons were brought from Valryia - Balerion, Vhagar and Meraxes had rejoined him with their Dragons after having been seperated for centuries - resulting in an unstoppable force that emerged as Aegon continued his push into new territories.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: King Mern had brought half again as many men to the battle as King Loren, and so demanded the honor of commanding the center. His son and heir, Edmund, was given the vanguard. King Loren and his knights would form the right, Lord Oakheart the left. With no natural barriers to anchor the Targaryen line, the Two Kings meant to sweep around Aegon on both flanks, then take him in the rear, whilst their “iron fist,” a great wedge of armored knights and high lords, smashed through Aegon’s center.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: King Mern and King Loren squared off against each other in the center of a grand battleground, with Aegon and Lord Oakheart by their side. As the battle commenced, King Mern demanded surrender from the second, who refused despite his body's weariness that brought him down to one knee. Soon enough, Aegon was given command of the field and he brought forth an anchor line formation that seemed to sweep through their enemies like wildfire, giving them little time to react as they were smashed by more than half again their already many Great forces.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Aegon Targaryen drew his own men up in a rough crescent bristling with spears and pikes, with archers and crossbowmen just behind and light cavalry on either flank. He gave command of his host to Jon Mooton, Lord of Maidenpool, one of the first foes to come over to his cause. The king himself intended to do his fighting from the sky, beside his queens. Aegon had noted the absence of rain as well; the grass and wheat that surrounded the armies was tall and ripe for harvest…and very dry.
verbs: intende to do his fighting from the sky
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Aegon Targaryen and Jon Mooton drew their forces to the edge of Maidenpool, bristling with intent. The sky was clear, which Aegon noted with some relief, for it meant he could intende to do his fighting from the sky. He observed the grasslands around him - rough tufts as though they had been pikes or spears pointing into battle; archers at intervals lending their small stature to shield their crossbowmen; small squadrons of light troops moving quickly across and tall stands of grain that were ripe for harvest in this very dry heat. This would not be an easy fight.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: The Targaryens waited until the Two Kings sounded their trumpets and started forward beneath a sea of banners. King Mern himself led the charge against the center on his golden stallion, his son Gawen beside him with his banner, a great green hand upon a field of white. Roaring and screaming, urged on by horns and drums, the Gardeners and Lannisters charged through a storm of arrows down unto their foes, sweeping aside the Targaryen spearmen, shattering their ranks. But by then Aegon and his sisters were in the air.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Gawen, Aegon and his sisters watched as King Mern waited atop his horse for the charge against the center to sound. Kings across Westeros had heard of what was happening in Maidenpool, and as Aegon drew a felling glance at his brisling war host he noted the absence of rain. The pikes and crossbowmen seemed to be itching for a fight and with such rough terrain ripe for harvest the ground already felt very dry. Two Kings charged forward on a golden stallion, led by Gawen, who hoped that if they swept through their forces would shatter whatever stood in their way. As they were urged forward by Aegon, who intended to do most of his fighting from skysborne Vhagar, they could only hope that this might work out well no matter what awaited them ahead.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Aegon flew above the ranks of his foes upon Balerion, through a storm of spears and stones and arrows, swooping down repeatedly to bathe his foes in flame. Rhaenys and Visenya set fires upwind of the enemy and behind them. The dry grasses and stands of wheat went up at once. The wind fanned the flames and blew the smoke into the faces of the advancing ranks of the Two Kings. The scent of fire sent their mounts into panic, and as the smoke thickened, horse and rider alike were blinded. Their ranks began to break as walls of fire rose on every side of them. Lord Mooton’s men, safely upwind of the conflagration, waited with their bows and spears, and made short work of the burned and burning men who came staggering from the inferno.
events: setting fires upwind , and behind the enemy
adjectives: storm of spears and stones and arrows
dry grasses and stands of wheat
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Aegon, atop Balerion the Black Dread, flied over the foes ranks in a blistering display of strength. Rhaenys and Visenya joined him soon after, swooping and setting fires upwind , and behind enemy lines as Lord Mooton urged them onward. The flames fanned out as they went up, blowing the smoke into their faces, while Aegon's forces waited with bows and spears at the ready. When he gave command for them to charge against the enemy line, Two Kings of Westeros - King Mern on his golden stallion and Gawen on his great green hand - led sweeping series of attacks that shattered what remained of their foe's will. His banners unfurled in glorious coloring above them as they made short work of any remaining resistance with a storm of spears and stones and arrows. As dry grasses surrounding them burned away beneath a shower of blazing embers even stands of wheat near fields glowed orange under their watchful eye.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: The Field of Fire, the battle was named afterward.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: General Jameson led the fray at the Fields of Fire with courage, fearlessly slicing through his enemies with impunity, as if he had dozens of Balerions swooping and setting fire upwind and behind them. The Targaryen host was no less ready for battle; Lord Aenar's maiden daughter Daenys and her three Valyrian dragons flew over the foe's ranks, bathing them in flames while Aerys, Aegon and Visenyas' dragons fanned fires and blew smoke into their faces. To add to this already impressive display of force, Her Grace Queen Rhaenys added to the pressure by raining down a storm of spears and stones from above - setting dry grasses and stands of wheat ablaze. Even so, it seemed General Jameson had met his match when their opponents waited with bows and spears - but his forces made short work of them all the same.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: More than four thousand men died in the flames. Another thousand perished by sword and spear and arrow. Tens of thousands suffered burns, some so bad that they would remain scarred for life. King Mern IX was amongst the dead, together with his sons, grandsons, brothers, cousins, and other kin. One nephew survived for three days. When he died of his burns, House Gardener died with him. King Loren of the Rock lived, riding through a wall of flame and smoke to safety when he saw the battle lost.
events: perished by sword and spear and arrow
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: King Mern IX and King Loren of the Rock fell in battle on the Field of Fire, led bravely against a frayed force of Harren the Black's army. Both kings perished by sword and spear and arrow, their bodies scorched by fire as their lives were snuffed out with nary a final wish reached. Yet perhaps it was for the better - many more would have suffered burns if they had lived to see another day. Valaena Targaryen, her Queens close behind, gathered forces from all Seven Kings to vanquish the enemy at last, but not without cost. Lord Massey and his Mudds had been pushed back alongside Princess Meria Martell who also suffered burns in her valiant attempt to save her people from destruction. The fierce Stormlanders who once defied Aegon I Targaryen's breath atop Balerion bid farewell to their fallen allies one by one until only a few remained standing, those who lived but forever remembered the loss of their brethren.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: The Targaryens lost fewer than a hundred men. Queen Visenya took an arrow in one shoulder, but soon recovered. As the dragons gorged themselves on the dead, Aegon commanded that the swords of the slain be gathered up and sent downriver.
events: lost fewer than a hundred men
Queen Visenya took an arrow in one shoulder
dragons gorged themselves on the dead
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Queen Visenya, gathered with her son Aegon and the rest of the Targaryen host at the Battle of Stone, where few were lost in comparison to their enemies. While King Mern IX and King Loren of the Rock perished by sword and spear and arrow, Queen Visenya lost fewer than a hundred men. She bravely stood her ground against her foes, but was sadly wounded when an arrow pierced through one shoulder. As a testament to their victory, Aegon’s dragons gorged themselves on the dead while Valaena’s Lady Marla Sunderland sent runners to inform Harren the Black that his dreams would die away in smoke.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Loren Lannister was captured the next day. The King of the Rock laid his sword and crown at Aegon’s feet, bent the knee, and did him homage. And Aegon, true to his promises, lifted his beaten foe back to his feet and confirmed him in his lands and lordship, naming him Lord of Casterly Rock and Warden of the West. Lord Loren’s bannermen followed his example, and so too did many lords of the Reach, those who had survived the dragonfire.
events: laid sword and crown at Aegon's feet
lifted beaten foe back to his feet
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Loren Lannister, who had survived the destruction of his home Casterly Rock, followed the Targeryen host and laid sword and crown at Aegon's feet. When Aegon lifted beaten foe back to his feet after he bent knee in homage, all of The Rock did as well. Now Loren was among their number when they made for the Reach and his sisters Meria and Valaena drawing near hopeful that King Loren would return safe from whence he came.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Yet the conquest of the west remained incomplete, so King Aegon parted from his sisters and marched at once for Highgarden, hoping to secure its surrender before some other claimant could seize it for his own. He found the castle in the hands of its steward, Harlan Tyrell, whose forebears had served the Gardeners for centuries. Tyrell yielded up the keys to the castle without a fight and pledged his support to the conquering king. In reward Aegon granted him Highgarden and all its domains, naming him Warden of the South and Lord Paramount of the Mander, and giving him dominion over all House Gardener’s former vassals.
events: pledged his support to the conquering king
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: King Aegon was impressed by Harlan Tyrell's will to join him in his conquest of the west and agreed when he yielded up Highgarden, naming it his own and granting the former Lord Tyrell his support and service. With a last parting march with Harlan at heart, The Targaryen host partied merrily as they traversed to other parts of the Seven Kingdoms, giving recognition and respect to those who had embraced them. Queen Rhaenys and her dragon Vhagar settled ahead of the troupe and as each place together granted fealty or yielded up their castles - from Riverrun to Stone Hedge - happily Garse VII Gardener did homage as had Loren Lannister – following which King Aegon lifted his beaten foe back to his feet.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: It was King Aegon’s intent to continue his march south and enforce the submission of Oldtown, the Arbor, and Dorne, but whilst at Highgarden word of a new challenge came to his ears. Torrhen Stark, King in the North, had crossed the Neck and entered the riverlands, leading an army of savage northmen thirty thousand strong. Aegon at once started north to meet him, racing ahead of his army on the wings of Balerion, the Black Dread. He sent word to his two queens as well, and to all the lords and knights who had bent the knee to him after Harrenhal and the Field of Fire.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: King Aegon continued his march south, leading the Targaryen host of thirty thousand strong. They crossed through The Neck into the Riverlands and started north towards Oldtown and The Arbor. On their way, they assaulted many former vassals who had yielded up to Aegon's conquest of the west -- Garse VII Gardener of Highgarden; Harren the Black, King Loren I Lannister and Queen Rhaenys Targaryen of The Rock; House Mudds and Masseys of Stonedance; Arryn kings Jon Mooton and Her yn Argilac; Celtigars from Claw Isle in Blackwater Bay; Lord Errol, Fell and Buckler from Sharp Point on Gods Eye lake; princes, princesses, Fishers from along Green Fork of the Trident river; ironmen from Iron Islands led by Harwyn Hardhand Hooks Blackwood, raiding parties from Dorne led by Princess Meria Martell. Fearful for his sovereignty Lord Torrhen Stark decided to yield when King Aerys made a detour through The North rather than wait for them to siege Winterfell. By granting clemency but still enforcing his subjugation he named Torrhen 'The King Who Knelt', giving rise to one more legend in Aegon's conquering mission.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: When Torrhen Stark reached the banks of the Trident, he found a host half again the size of his own awaiting him south of the river. Riverlords, westermen, stormlanders, men of the Reach…all had come. And above their camp Balerion, Meraxes, and Vhagar prowled the sky in ever-widening circles.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: As Torrhen Stark reached the Trident, south of the river, his army was becoming more and more tiring after traveling so far. He knew that a formidable force awaited him there: The Riverlords, the Westermen, stormlanders and men of the Reach had gathered with an advantage of almost half again as many men as him. He prowled around their camp in anticipation of what would come next. With Harren the Black dead, Loren of House Lannister leading his banners northwards and Aegon's vast Targaryen host racing ahead savagely towards King's Landing with thirty thousand strong – now was time to establish a place amongst these Seven Kingdoms or otherwise face destruction at their hands.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Torrhen’s scouts had seen the ruins of Harrenhal, where slow red fires still burned beneath the rubble. The King in the North had heard many accounts of the Field of Fire as well. He knew that the same fate might await him if he tried to force a crossing of the river. Some of his lords bannermen urged him to attack all the same, insisting that northern valor would carry the day. Others urged him to fall back to Moat Cailin and make his stand there on northern soil. The king’s bastard brother Brandon Snow offered to cross the Trident alone under cover of darkness, to slay the dragons whilst they slept.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Torrhen, known then as The King in the North, had reached Harrenhal and heard that Brandon Snow was urging his men to cross the Trident. Torrhen insisted that they retreat back to Moat Cailin, offering a slow fall back rather than getting caught up in a fight between two of Aegon the Conqueror's generals—Arrec and Errol. When he offered this plan, the Lords Fell and Buckler saw the wisdom in it and Torrhen became famous for being 'The King who Knelt'. After much questioning by Loren of House Lannister in Harrenhal, orders were finally issued for a general retreat south of the river. Word spread quickly across Lyanna Stark’s rivers holdings like wildfire; every Riverlord from westermen to Stormlanders to men of The Reach wanted half again of their sworn armies at Moat Cailin before her order could come just shortlifting Garse VII Gardener's expectation!  As Aerys' Targaryen host prowled near victoriously on its course westward, even lords from Dorne sent small raiding parties into the Riverlands as part of Queen Rhaenys ’Vhagar’s show-of-force campaign against Harren Hal and Loren I Lannister — showing what havoc arose when you disobeyed Seven Kings. As panic began setting within Mern IX's western court after hearing about House Hoar's defeat at Stonedance - Torrhen Stark still found solace under his father Lord Edmyn Tully’s watchful eye, knowing all too well what happened when Prince Arrec refused Strong Durrandons or Lady Marla Sunderland–the princess Meria Martell dedicated herself bravely rallying all his sisters Vales houses based on Queens sharra – something not even Maegon made one case study would suggest…

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: King Torrhen did send Brandon Snow across the Trident. But he crossed with three maesters by his side, not to kill but to treat. All through the night messages went back and forth. The next morning, Torrhen Stark himself crossed the Trident. There upon the south bank of the Trident, he knelt, laid the ancient crown of the Kings of Winter at Aegon’s feet, and swore to be his man. He rose as Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North, a king no more. From that day to this day, Torrhen Stark is remembered as the King Who Knelt…but no northman left his burned bones beside the Trident, and the swords Aegon collected from Lord Stark and his vassals were not twisted nor melted nor bent.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: King Torrhen, Brandon Snow and the maesters reached the Trident. Aegon stood there as they crossed it, and King Torrhen knelt before him and swore to be his man. As Torrhen rose from his knees, he remembered that ancient northman prophecy he had heard in Harrenhal; "The time will come when a dragon shall be no more a fantasy." With these encouraging words of caution, Torrhen sent Brandon Snow ahead to Winterfell while he went to Moat Cailin to meet with Queen Rhaenys Targaryen, who had sworn an oath of loyalty to Aegon at Field of Fire. It was there she implored them all not to give up hope: "You remember," she said gravely as the impending battle weighed on their hearts like granite stones. "This is an ancient northman's fight for freedom against Seven Kings… together we can win this!" Both men nodded in agreement and turned back towards the Trident with newfound resolve — driven by duty and guided by courage

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Now Aegon Targaryen and his queens parted company. Aegon turned south once again, marching toward Oldtown, whilst his two sisters mounted their dragons—Visenya for the Vale of Arryn and Rhaenys for Sunspear and the deserts of Dorne.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Visenya, Rhaenys and Aegon Targaryen parted company with their maesters in Trident. They mounted their dragons and turned south along the river towards the lands of Dorne, the Vale of Arryn and Sunspear. Aegon remembered his great ancestor Harren the Black who had once crossed the Trident in search of his throne. He rose then as Lord of all Seven Kingdoms, a northman he said, one to lay claim to ancient kingdoms that no longer existed. Together they flew high up over Oldtown remembering him again before entering Westeros anew.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Sharra Arryn had strengthened the defenses of Gulltown, moved a strong host to the Bloody Gate, and tripled the size of the garrisons in Stone, Snow, and Sky, the waycastles that guarded the approach to the Eyrie. All these defenses proved useless against Visenya Targaryen, who rode Vhagar’s leathery wings above them all and landed in the Eyrie’s inner courtyard. When the regent of the Vale rushed out to confront her, with a dozen guards at her back, she found Visenya with Ronnel Arryn seated on her knee, staring at the dragon, wonder- struck. “Mother, can I go flying with the lady?” the boy king asked. No threats were spoken, no angry words exchanged. The two queens smiled at one another and exchanged courtesies instead. Then Lady Sharra sent for the three crowns (her own regent’s coronet, her son’s small crown, and the Falcon Crown of Mountain and Vale that the Arryn kings had worn for a thousand years), and surrendered them to Queen Visenya, along with the swords of her garrison. And it was said afterward that the little king flew thrice about the summit of the Giant’s Lance, and landed to find himself a little lord. Thus did Visenya Targaryen bring the Vale of Arryn into her brother’s realm.
events: Surrendered the three crowns and swords of the garrison
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Visenya Targaryen, Ronnel Arryn and Sharra Arryn gathered outside the walls of Gulltown as the high sun painted the sky orange. The garrison had surrendered the three crowns and swords that symbolized their loyalty to House Targaryen. Aegon's host had strengthened considerably since they parted company with Loren Lannister and turned south towards Dorne eight months ago, having mounted their dragons at Sunspear two weeks prior. As a gesture of goodwill, Visenya handed Princess Meria Martell a basket of fruits from Highgarden in exchange for leathery wings for her dragon Vhagar. Lord Arrec noticed Queen Rhaenys admiring an old weirwood tree outside his castle gates surrounded by dragons from Harren the Black's strong host, plants that had been standing there for thousands of years or more. He sent for Mallisters, Celtigars and Mudds to join his new friends at Sky who quickly tripled his ranks at Stone after hearing King Aerys' call. With newfound confidence, Ronnel moved through Snow towards Eyrie where he rushes to declare allegiance to House Targaryen while Sharra exchanged friendly smiles with Princess Valaena Targaryen and spoke fondly of her father Maegon who had recently ascended the Iron Throne by force after ousting Seven Kings who fell before him.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Rhaenys Targaryen had no such easy conquest. A host of Dornish spearmen guarded the Prince’s Pass, the gateway through the Red Mountains, but Rhaenys did not engage them. She flew above the pass, above the red sands and the white, and descended upon Vaith to demand its submission, only to find the castle empty and abandoned. In the town beneath its walls, only women and children and old men remained. When asked where their lords had gone, they would only say, “Away.” Rhaenys followed the river downstream to Godsgrace, seat of House Allyrion, but it too was deserted. On she flew. Where the Greenblood met the sea, Rhaenys came upon the Planky Town, where hundreds of poleboats, fishing skiffs, barges, houseboats, and hulks sat baking in the sun, joined together with ropes and chains and planks to make a floating city, yet only a few old women and small children appeared to peer up at her as Meraxes circled overhead.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Queen Rhaenys Targaryen crossed the Red Mountains with her brother and sisters in the dragon-riding host that followed Aegon the Conqueror during his conquest of Westeros. When they arrived at Vaith, it did not take long for their strong army to occupy Godsgrace, Planky Town, Prince's Pass and Greenblood. The Dornish lords deserted their castles easily and even those who had guarded Prince's Pass were gone. Following them further south from there was a much easier mission than expected; many towns were deserted or loosely held by small bands of local soldiers who quickly surrendered once they saw the leathery wings carrying the Targaryen Host flying high above them. With a tripled speed, they moved into royal palaces where King Loren Lannister greeted them with smiles as he exchanged greetings with Lord Aenar’s maiden daughter Daenys in honor of her thousand years of prophesizing. As Sharra Arryn sent for Ronnel Arryn down at Gulltown, Visenya Targaryen spoke of goals to defeat Harren the Black and strengthen the rule over Seven Kingdoms. Thus began Rhaenys' adventure as she marched forward on her white dragon Meraxes in attempt to end House Hoare's vile legacy from Iron Islands to Riverlands—a journey that would bring back days she had only seen whispered about through Valyrian artifacts Her Father brought back from Old Valryia before Queen Rhaenhys entered Westeros during Aegon’s Landing two hundred years ago .

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Finally the queen’s flight took her to Sunspear, the ancient seat of House Martell, where she found the Princess of Dorne waiting in her abandoned castle. Meria Martell was eighty years of age, the maesters tell us, and had ruled the Dornishmen for sixty of those years. She was very fat, blind, and almost bald, her skin sallow and sagging. Argilac the Arrogant had named her “the Yellow Toad of Dorne,” but neither age nor blindness had dulled her wits.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Queen Rhaenys Targaryen had conquered the lands of Dorne without much difficulty - every village and town remained deserted. Even Vaith, Godsgrace, Greenblood, and Planky Town refused to stand against her forces. Her conquest was followed by Princess of Dorne Meria Martell who took the rule over Sunspear and House Martell with an iron fist. Despite having a reputation of being ruthless leader, she was named after Argilac the Arrogant, an ancient fat and almost bald man who had been blind since birth but nevertheless ruled them well before her reign. The sallow complexion and sagging form attributed to this Queen inspired loyalty from all corners under her rule.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: “I will not fight you,” Princess Meria told Rhaenys, “nor will I kneel to you. Dorne has no king. Tell your brother that.”
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Princess Meria and Rhaenys of Dorne had a fight on their hands as they knelt before Argilac the Arrogant, King of the Storm Lands. Everyone watched as Meria led her people through centuries of ancient reigns from kings such as Harren the Black and Loren of House Lannister. The eyes that peered at them dulled slightly in acceptance when Meria told him the tales and secrets to prove she was descended from Targaryen hosts, and his almost-bald head shone with sallow skin, creasing into folds around his blind eyes and sagging cheeks. Her words were strong, giving a promise of what could be should she take back control; not only for her but House Martell, Sunspear and all those who called her name etching it into history.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: “I shall,” Rhaenys replied, “but we will come again, Princess, and the next time we shall come with fire and blood.”
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Rhaenys and Princess Meria had left Dorne fighting to fulfill their quest, which they could not tell. Together they shall come again, this time with an army of Targaryen hosts led by the exiled Lord Aenar's maiden daughter Daenys. As Aegon and his sisters Visenya and Aerys arrived in Westeros, all Seven Kings had to kneel down before them or face the might of Balerion and the other dragons of House Targaryen. Inpired by such strength, King Mern IX of Storm's End joined forces with Maegon against Argilac The Arrogant. This union was destined to put Rhaenys on her throne as Queen - a hope unfulfilled until now after two decades had passed from Her audacious decision.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: “Your words,” said Princess Meria. “Ours are Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken. You may burn us, my lady…but you will not bend us, break us, or make us bow. This is Dorne. You are not wanted here. Return at your peril.”
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Meria swept into Dorne, determined to burn and bend and break the kingdom until it bowed before her. Her own father had been unable to return unbowed, unbent, and unbroken -- but Meria swore she would not suffer the same fate. As she rode through the moonlit night, Harren the Black, Loren of House Lannister, Targaryen host of old, Daenys the Dreamer -- all raising high in her thoughts with every step forward. The battles that were yet to come would decide if she returned triumphant or lost forever.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Thus queen and princess parted, and Dorne remained unconquered.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Princess Meria of Dorne parted ways with you unbowed, unbent and unbroken. She remained in Dorne while queen Daenys the Dreamer Targaryen had already ventured beyond Valyria to take her place among the Seven Kings. Through her voyage to conquer Storm's End, Queen Rhaenys showed the world that an unbruised, undaunted woman could still do battle against all odds, coming face to face with Harren the Black--Loren of House Lannister's father, cursed by his own creations at Harrenhal. With Aerys and Aegon I Targaryen as her lieutenants, she carved out a swath through Westeros until she arrived under the parapets of Storm's End where King Argilac proudly declared that no heraldry but his own would bend or break with that stronghold. Eventually Queen Rhaenys was able to burn and bow strong enough for King Loren Lannister--father of Princess Meria Martell--to return unharmed from his Valley-wide conquest spurred by Aegon I Targaryen's partiarchal fervor flying on Balerion over ancient battlefields long maned by Mern IX and Emmon Massey before him.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: To the west, Aegon Targaryen met a warmer welcome. The greatest city in all of Westeros, Oldtown was ringed about with massive walls, and ruled by the Hightowers of the Hightower, the oldest, richest, and most powerful of the noble houses of the Reach. Oldtown was also the center of the Faith. There dwelt the High Septon, Father of the Faithful, the voice of the new gods on earth, who commanded the obedience of millions of devout throughout the realms (save in the North, where the old gods still held sway), and the blades of the Faith Militant, the fighting order the smallfolk called the Stars and Swords.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Aegon Targaryen surveyed Westeros from his castle at Oldtown, an island held by the powerful Hightowers since before Ser Harren the Black had ringed his own domain with massive walls. Here Aegon held sway in what was once thought to be the warmest, greatest kingdom of them all, its oldest and richest seat of learning in all of Westeros. The Reach was still the most powerful region with its massive holdings sprawling through the riverlands, the westerlands and north into the stormlands; Aegon was now lord over it all.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Yet when Aegon Targaryen and his host approached Oldtown, they found the city gates open and Lord Hightower waiting to make his submission. As it happened, when word of Aegon’s landing first reached Oldtown, the High Septon had locked himself within the Starry Sept for seven days and seven nights, seeking the guidance of the gods. He took no nourishment but bread and water, and spent all his waking hours in prayer, moving from one altar to the next. And on the seventh day, the Crone had lifted up her golden lamp to show him the path ahead. If Oldtown took up arms against Aegon the Dragon, His High Holiness saw, the city would surely burn, and the Hightower and the Citadel and the Starry Sept would be cast down and destroyed.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Aegon Targaryen approached Oldtown in the Reach and Lord Hightower welcomed him alongside the High Septon. His 600-ship armada had taken three weeks to reach its destination, having locked about Westeros from his Landing at Winterfell in the North, seeking submission from all who had held sway over it. After spending some time at Starry Sept, the Targaryen host sought acceptance in Oldtown and Aegon I lifted up his banner, inviting those he found there to take up arms with him and share in his golden destiny.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Manfred Hightower, Lord of Oldtown, was a cautious lord and godly. One of his younger sons served with the Warrior’s Sons, and another had only recently taken vows as a septon. When the High Septon told him of the vision vouchsafed him by the Crone, Lord Hightower determined that he would not oppose the Conqueror by force of arms. Thus it was that no men from Oldtown burned on the Field of Fire, though the Hightowers were bannermen to the Gardeners of Highgarden. And thus it was that Lord Manfred rode forth to greet Aegon the Dragon as he approached, and to offer up his sword, his city, and his oath. (Some say that Lord Hightower also offered up the hand of his youngest daughter, which Aegon declined politely, lest it offend his two queens.)
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Manfred Hightower had been cautious, but the godly vision vouchsafed by the Crone had been too much to oppose. He gave his youngest daughter's hand in marriage to Aegon and lifted up and took up arms for him, riding forth along with all of the Warrior's Sons to greet Aegon Targaryen on the Field of Fire. There beneath Oldtown, they burned their swords with Lord Hightower and High Septon in submission - loyal to the Targaryens, unyielding as Aegon made his landing in Highgarden - though her name has since become forgotten in the lore surrounding those days.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Three days later, in the Starry Sept, His High Holiness himself anointed Aegon with the seven oils, placed a crown upon his head, and proclaimed him Aegon of House Targaryen, the First of His Name, King of the Andals, the Rhoynar, and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, and Protector of the Realm. (“Seven Kingdoms” was the style used, though Dorne had not submitted. Nor would it, for more than a century to come.)
events: anointed Aegon with the seven oils
placed a crown upon his head
proclaimed him Aegon of House Targaryen
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: The High Septon, and the other Holy Men from Oldtown arrived at the Starry Sept to anoint Aegon with the seven oils. His High Holiness placed the crown upon Aegon's head and proclaimed him as Aegon of House Targaryen, King of Seven Kingdoms. As news began to spread across Westeros, forces were gathering in support or oppose this new leader: Lord Mooton had called on his brother’s knights; Queen Rhaenys rallied her Stormlanders forces to her side; Harren The Black led his Ironmen forces south; Loren Lannister marched forth on behalf of two kings he had previously offered fealty to--King Argilac of House Durrandon and Garse VII Gardener of Highgarden. All felt uncertain about this turn events yet obligated for loyalty—for Aegon was delivered into their lives through a vision vouchsafed by Crone, which spoke clearly even unto them who stood farthest from field where he was burned on Field of Fire when riding forth to greet him.  It has been said that Aegon offered up oath, offered up sword and offered hand of youngest daughter-- Princess Meria Martell-- continuing his cautious but godly rule over Westeros henceforth.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Only a handful of lords had been present for Aegon’s first coronation at the mouth of the Blackwater, but hundreds were on hand to witness his second, and tens of thousands cheered him afterward in the streets of Oldtown as he rode through the city on Balerion’s back. Amongst those at Aegon’s second coronation were the maesters and archmaesters of the Citadel. Perhaps for that reason, it was this coronation, rather than the Aegonfort crowning on the day of Aegon’s landing, that became fixed as the start of Aegon’s reign.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Aegon's first coronation commenced at the Starry Sept, and the presence of Aegon's most loyal followers such as Lord Aenar's maiden daughter Daenys and Harren the Black near Stonedance bore witness to this historic event. After receiving anointment with the seven oils, a crown was placed upon his head and he was proclaimed to be 'Aegon of House Targaryen', destined to conquer Seven Kingdoms. His second coronation took place in Oldtown after completing a tour across Blackwater, where many cheered for him even though it lacked grandeur compared to his first. When Aegonfort was finished being constructed at the mouth of Blackwater Rush, Balerion - one of Aegon's dragons - fixed its position as capital by landing upon its parapets while bearing Aegon on its back. The lords both present and in attendance cheered when they saw how victorious their lord looked; indeed, it seemed like there truly could not have been a better way to celebrate his crowning than this very moment.

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Thus were the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros hammered into one great realm, by the will of Aegon the Conqueror and his sisters.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: Aegon the Conqueror and his sisters gathered their armies throughout the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros with a singular goal in mind; hammering into one great realm. From Harrens father in Iron Islands, to Aerys Targaryen in Valyria, every Lord, prince and maester were summoned to witness Aegon's coronations - first at Aegonfort crowning him King among seven kings who came voluntarily, then followed by Aegon's second coronation in Oldtown where he crowned himself as the king of all lands from the Neck on the North, to Dorne on the south. Everywhere they went crowds cheered for them as they rode Balerion, Visenya and Meraxes across Westeros. As was written; "When you are fixed upon a course determined by your will alone nothing can stand against you".

01-aegon's conquest.paragraph: Many thought that King Aegon would make Oldtown his royal seat after the wars were done, whilst others thought he would rule from Dragonstone, the ancient island citadel of House Targaryen. The king surprised them all by proclaiming his intent to make his court in the new town already rising upon the three hills at the mouth of the Blackwater Rush, where he and his sisters had first set foot on the soil of Westeros. King’s Landing, the new town would be called. From there Aegon the Dragon would rule his realm, holding court from a great metal seat made from the melted, twisted, beaten, and broken blades of all his fallen foes, a perilous seat that would soon be known through all the world as the Iron Throne of Westeros.
01-aegon's conquest.text-davinci-003: King Aegon and his sisters of House Targaryen had succeeded in hammering into one great realm the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros with their will alone. With the wars waged by King Aegon, he made it clear that there would be only one ruler reigning over Oldtown, Dragonstone, Blackwater Rush, Westeros and Kings Landing. He set up ancient castles as strongholds to declare his rule while rising forces such as Lords Fell and Buckler from Storm combined with Gardeners from The Reach held perilous positions throughout the continent. With each proclamation a new legend was born as Harren the Black, Loren of House Lannister and Targaryen host including Lord Aenar's maiden daughter Daenys Aerys yielded to make way for what is now remembered as one of the great conquerors in history - Aegon I Targaryen.
